dmca.title: Blogger DMCA Complaint- Linda Ellis
dmca.body:
Here is another of your sites with my copyrighted poem posted on it. My complete DMCA Complaint is below, including signature, etc.

Thank you,

Linda Ellis
www.lindaellisonline.com

Hello,

Below is my good faith statement and copyright information. The site
http://lifeinanut.blogspot.com/2006/11/did-you-live-your-dash.html hosted by blogspot.com has my copyrighted work, "The Dash" posted unauthorized and unaccredited. The copyright # as filed with the Library of Congress for this work is Txu 858-108. 1 have contacted you previously regarding this problem and this is a current site found from a Google search. Thank you.

INFORMATION AS REQUESTED CONCERNING A COPYRIGHT INFRINGEMENT OF MY WORK BY ONE OF YOUR MEMBERS:

1. A description of the copyrighted work or other intellectual property that you claim has been infringed;

Poem titled The Dash, which is under registered copyright # TXu 858-108. Text is included at the end of this email.

2. A description of the location where the material that you claim is infringing is

The poem is posted unauthorized and mostly unaccredited on this site:
http://lifeinanut.blogspot.com/2006/11/did-you-live-your-dash.html

3. A statement by you that you have a good faith belief that the reported use is not authorized by the copyright or intellectual property owner, its agent, or the law;

I hereby state that permission was never granted for use of this copyrighted work on the web site sent here by myself, the author and copyright owner, or any agents or representatives of my company, Linda's Lyrics.

4. Your address, telephone number, and, if available, e-mail address;

Linda Ellis
Linda's Lyrics
1050 E. Piedmont Road
Suite E-135
Marietta. GA 30062
lellis@bellsouth.net
404-966-3349

5. A statement by you, made under penalty of perjury, that the above information is accurate and that you are the copyright or intellectual property owner or authorized to act on the copyright or intellectual property owner's behalf; and

Under penalty of perjury, I hereby state that the above information is accurate and that I am the copyright owner of the material posted unaccredited and unauthorized on the website contained in this email:
http://lifeinanut.blogspot.com/2006/11/did-you-live-your-dash.html

6. An electronic or physical signature by the person making the submission (i.e., you or such other person authorized to act on behalf of the complaining party). If the submission is made electronically, the authorized person making the submission should designate his or her electronic signature by typing a forward slash ("/") before and after his or her typed name and follow this electronic signature by again typing his or her name.

Linda's Lyrics
1050 E. Piedmont Road
Suite E-135
Marietta, GA 30062
www.lindaslyrics.com

The Dash
by Linda Ellis
Copyright Txu-858-108

I read of a man who stood to speak
at the funeral of a friend.
He referred to the dates on her tombstone
from the beginning...to the end.
He noted that first came the date of her birth
and spoke of the following date with tears,
but he said what mattered most of all
was the dash between those years.
For that dash represents all the time
that she spent alive on earth
and now only those who loved her
know what that little line is worth.
For it matters not, how much we own,
the cars, the house, the cash.
What matters is how we live and love
and how we spend our dash.
So think about this long and hard,
are there things you'd like to change?
For you never know how much time is left
that can still be rearranged.
If we could just slow down enough
to consider what's true and real
and always try to understand
the way other people feel.
And be less quick to anger
and show appreciation more
and love the people in our lives
like we've never loved before.
If we treat each other with respect
and more often wear a smile
remembering that this special dash
might only last a little while.
So when your eulogy is being read
with your life's actions to rehash,
would you be proud of the things they say
about how you spent your dash?
